text: OK! Let’s dig in.
hi <@UQD6TG8UQ> i can help you out
you want mega menu or simple menu?
ok i got it
Btw thanks for your explanation

Hello! I'm trying to add a google font to only a select few custom coded modules. I was told I could add the Google font to the stylesheet and then specify it inline in the modules, but it isn't showing up any different. All of the articles I've found have been a sort of wild goose chase, and none of the offered solutions have worked. Is there more direct documentation someone can point me towards or could I get another set of eyes?

If you add your @font-face declarations to the style sheet, then you can use a custom css class on the module, or inspect the code to find the unique module id class assigned by HubSpot, then you can call out the elements you want to change within the module using one of those classes.
Thank you! I'll try that in a minute
if you're coding the custom modules yourself, then you could add the css declarations directly in the module - but you would need to link to the stylesheet where you have the fonts loaded
How do I link the the stylesheet in a module that doesn't have a header section?

Hiya. I am trying use a crm card with my app, but it isnt working. In the monitoring tab it says IO Error (whatever that means) but when i visit the URL in the details pane, it works as expected. Any help/ideas would be greatly appreciated
where are you putting the CSS for the module?
and old template module or new theme DND module?
I'm not sure! It's a clone of an existing module. I didn't build it.
Do you have any screenshots?
I'm not seeing any linked stylesheets. There's some inline styling but when I replace the fonts with the right one it isn't showing up/

Sure, he is the URL in the photo as well. <https://webhooks.dev.pacificmarketinglabs.io/currencyr8/crmcard?userId=27507381&userEmail=james.sheales@pacificmarketing.co.uk&associatedObjectId=5598522824&associatedObjectType=DEAL&portalId=26313801&amount=1666.96&deal_currency_code=EUR|https://webhooks.dev.pacificmarketinglabs.io/currencyr8/crmcard?userId=27507381&userEmail=james[…]lId=26313801&amount=1666.96&deal_currency_code=EUR>
do you have this module on a live website page already?
It's for email. The cloned modules aren't being used live anywhere yet.
ah, I see, that's a totally different story
you can't add custom fonts to an email template
And you said that the card on the page is working
emails can't access external style sheets
Okay, I was told by a support specialist there was a way, but all of the articles have been dead ends. Someone told me I could do it inline. Is that wrong?
Nope, sorry if I was unclear, the card is not working in the UI, but the response from the URL is as expected.
I found this article, technically you can, but the fonts won't render for most email clients, it is not considered to be a best practice or something I would recommend doing
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/use-fonts-in-HubSpot>
this section has the steps needed: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/use-fonts-in-HubSpot#use-a-google-font-in-a-custom-coded-email-template>
the response from the webhook?
Yep. Have just done some further testing, and logged everytime a request was made to that endpoint on our server, and nothing happens from HubSpot. HubSpot doesnt seem to be reaching my server?
That would probably because of the webhook url, is it protected?
I would suggest testing with <http://webhook.site|webhook.site> and setting the response to be what you would expect
URL says https but says not secure at the top, guessing thats the culprit then?
Okay, but if the template doesn't have a <head> I can't do anything?
I think so
Damn ok, will go and try sort that out. Cheers for the help man :+1:
HubSpot docs don't mention requiring ssl webhooks but they might
So https only no http
100% let me know what you find or if you need anymore help
have you tried adding one?
Thanks, huge help, massivly appreciated
it's really hard to know what is possible without seeing the code and how the module is set up
Okay! I'll give it a shot. It seems like it just picks up in the body.
No luck, unfortunately. I wish I could just give up, but my boss is dead set on it now that that one guy told us it's possible.
have you tried using @ import?
```@import url('<https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Open+Sans>');```
the other way is with a link
```<link href="<https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Open+Sans>" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">```
and here is the inline style if you want to use @ font-face (not sure if this is what you already tried
obviously replacing Open Sans with whatever font you are trying to use
I've tried all of those, but it doesn't seem to make a difference even when I add a <head>

Hi all! Junior DevOps (RevOps) conducting some really simple methods that I know for sure, I'll need some assistance on. I'm trying to have either a workflow or built in form fill at the quote level that requires information to be filled out by the potential customer. Would building this into quotes break the quotes functionality at all? DM me, if you can. Would love to hear more on this .. <#C22PU4LV8|general>
